survey.name: NMC Course Survey
survey.description: Survey for the Course New Media & Communication 2010-2011

question.label: Welcome
question.htmlInstruction:
this is from york

Welcome at the New Media & Communication Survey. In this survey we'll ask you several questions regarding the new media in general. This course, the 'new media' mastertrack at the University of Twente and finally your use of the new media. Filling in this survey should not take you more than 10 minutes. Your answers will be treated confidentially.

The first 5 questions are about the (new media) master program at the University of Twente.

question.label: continuous
question.htmlInstruction: this is a test again

question.label: hello test
question.htmlInstruction: this is a instruction

question.label: StudentType
question.htmlInstruction:
What type of student are you?

Please select only the most appropriate answer.

field.name: Retaker
field.label: Bachelor Communication student who re-takes (part) of the course

field.name: BachelorUT
field.label: Bachelor student University of Twente from any other study

field.name: MasterUT
field.label: Master student University of Twente from any other study

question.label: Master
question.htmlInstruction: Do you intend to get your masters degree?

field.name: Bachelor
field.label: No, I will stop when I have my Bachelor's degree

field.name: MasterCSUT
field.label: Yes, I want to get my communication master at the University of Twente

field.name: MasterUT
field.label: Yes, I will get another master's degree at the University of Twente

field.name: MasterElse
field.label: Yes, but it will probably not be at the University of Twente

question.label: MasterTrack
question.htmlInstruction:
If your were to pick any of the available Communication master programs at the University of Twente, which one would you pick?

(none Communication Students, please skip this question)

question.label: MasterPerceptions
question.htmlInstruction: How do you see the ‘new media’ masters’ program?

field.name: Knowledge
field.label: I know a lot about this program

field.name: JobMarket
field.label: This program gives me good opportunities on the job market

question.label: Coverage
question.htmlInstruction: To what degree do you expect the following to be covered in the new media mastertrack?

field.name: Use
field.label: The use of new media in society

field.name: SotA
field.label: State of the art of new tools (e.g. Twitter, Social Networking)

field.name: Discussion
field.label: (active) Discussion about future developments of the new media

field.name: Advisor
field.label: Training in becoming a new media advisor/consultant

question.label: derived attributes: Degrees
question.htmlInstruction: This is a auto generated question when creating derived attribute.

question.label: derived attributes: Degree
question.htmlInstruction: This is a auto generated question when creating derived attribute.

question.label: MasterWhy
question.htmlInstruction: Why would you pick this master program?

field.name: WhyMaster
field.label: Why would you pick this master program?

question.label: Intro Usage
question.htmlInstruction: The following questions deal with your usage of the new media

question.label: Usage
question.htmlInstruction: Please respond to the statements below

field.name: eavy user
field.label: I consider myself a heavy user of the new media

field.name: expert
field.label: I consider myself an expert on the field of new media

field.name: digital skills
field.label: I consider myself heaving high digital skills

question.label: OnlineTools
question.htmlInstruction: Have you ever used the following online sites and/or services?

field.name: User Profiles
field.label: User profiles so that the communication can be tailored to the individual customer (e.g. MS Passport)

field.name: GIS
field.label: Geographical applications, like Google maps, GPS, GIS systems

field.name: Transactions
field.label: Transaction applications (for example for making payments, subscribing for services)

scale.name: Never
scale.label: I know what it is, but I've never used it

scale.name: Once
scale.label: I've tried it once, but ave never used it since

scale.name: Yes
scale.label: Yes, I've used it in the past, but I don't use it nowadays

scale.name: Sometimes
scale.label: Yes, I currently use it sometimes

scale.name: Often
scale.label: Yes, I currently use it often

question.label: Know More
question.htmlInstruction: About what aspects of the new media in general would you like to know more?

field.name: Know More 2
field.label: Please tell us what you miss in the current program and what you'd like to know/learn about the new media in general.

question.label: StudentSelect
question.htmlInstruction:
Select among your fellow students and the teachers of this course the ones you talk to the most about this course?

(If you don't talk to anyone, select none. Try to select some 5-10 names maximum)

Instructions: select a name (or more using Ctrl & Shift) and move them to the right using the arrow button ">". This way you can also move names back to the left.

question.label: rc
question.htmlInstruction: who you know?

question.label: People_Channels
question.htmlInstruction:
From the same list of people, please tell me the most preferred way you would use to communicate with each person about this course.

[please pick only one answer per person]

field.name: Weblog
field.label: Read on comment on their weblog

field.name: Social_Network
field.label: Contact via a social network (e.g. Hyves)

question.label: Student_Freq
question.htmlInstruction: From this list of students/teachers you created, how often do you use them to get information?

question.label: MediaSelect
question.htmlInstruction:
From this list of media sources, please tell me the most important ones you use the most to get information about the new media in general.

(If you don't use anyone, select none. Try to select some 5-10 names maximum)

Instructions: select a name (or more using Ctrl & Shift) and move them to the right using the arrow button ">". This way you can also move names back to the left.

question.label: MediaFrequency
question.htmlInstruction: From this list of media sources you created, how often do you use them to get information?

question.label: Media_Channels
question.htmlInstruction:
People can consume media in different ways. For example, someone might prefer reading the Chicago Tribune in print, but you might prefer reading the Chicago Tribune online.

From this list, please tell me how you prefer to consume these media.

[please pick only one answer per medium]

NB. Some of the media sources listed can be accessed only via one channel, however some others can be accessed via multiple ways.

question.label: Thanks
question.htmlInstruction: You’ve completed the survey! Thanks for responding. Please post on Twitter your comments on the survey.
